Main content start



 

 
The Stanford Faculty Staff Help Center offers a variety of services for the Stanford community, including confidential counseling, workshops, discussion groups, department consultations, and facilitated conversations.





 






Short-term counseling
If you are a resident of California, you can get Short-term help with job-related issues, relationship issues, parent-child concerns, addiction issues, grief and loss, depression and anxiety, retirement, and referrals to community resources.
Out-Of-State Employees: Stanford benefited employees who are located outside of the state of California may access this dedicated out-of-state Employee Assistance Program.
Request a counseling appointment









Management and department coaching and consultation
Individuals and work groups may request creative training, team effectiveness support, and help to develop performance and workplace well-being skills.
Visit our Management and Department Coaching and Consultation page to learn more.
 Request a departmental consultation

Services
We offer a variety of services for the Stanford community including counseling, workshops, discussion groups, facilitated conversations, consultation and training, and retreat facilitation. All services are free of charge.
Learn more about our services







 














Meet Our Staff
The Center is staffed by licensed clinical social workers, marriage and family therapists, psychologists, and experienced interns.
Read More
